919448529667@s.whatsapp.net (919448529667@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.09 - 20:08:53
A woman after marriage has to take mantropadesha from Guru. Preferably from Swamiji and if not possible from husband. Usually soon after marriage she goes to swamiji alongwith husband. She has to do sankalp (the husband does it) for taptamudra dharana and mantra sveekaar. After tapta mudra she should get mantropadesha. A book is given. Stree japa vidhih. After that she has to apply single chidra nama on lalata and all mudras same as men. Do the nyasas, dhyana, japa , again nyasa, dhyana tarpana and krishnarpana. She may then recite any stotra she likes. The mantra given is krishna shadakshara. This should be done everyday except the three days.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)

2017.04.09 - 20:23:22
Linga is a form (shape) that is normally associated with some thing long rounded and may be tall also. Thus a tall Shila pratime may be initially referred to as linga that can be further sculpted as krishna. During exodus of gsbs they carried a prateeka of their "mool". These prateeka were in many forms. If we understand the above, we can accept Sri Damodar worshipped in linga roop.

There are many types of japa maala. Kamal is used for laxmi japa rudraksh in shiva, tulasi for narayana astakshar. We choose depending upon the devatha. Since many years I was researching on this spatika for woman japa. Tulasi maala for narayana astakshar for men is widely accepted and easy to convince in this forum. I have noticed many women who have taken krishna shadakshara jap shy away in daily routine of nama mudra Japaâ€‹ as prescribed in sthree sandyavandan. Some are blessed with peaceful life but many live in tension family problems children problem financial independence interdependency etc., Under this circumstances the goodness of spatika helps them to cool down relieve stress and concentrate on japa.

Some basic information on subject open for study will be posted by noon ğŸ™ğŸ¼
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.10 - 10:55:33
We discussed the most important and basic point of the five that *Vishnu is supreme* we now move on to the second point *2. There is difference between Lord (Paramathma i.e Vishnu) and the Living individuals (athma). Lord is infinite and we souls are finite. There is also differences among each souls* .... The subject that is open for learning now is the very important concept of *bheda* essential difference between the supreme Vishnu and rest of everything that exists. In this we take up the bheda between chetanas. Vishnu is not only a chetana but something more than a mere chetana. He is the essence of the chetanas. The major questions that rise in our mind , are there different chetanas? If so, what leads to this difference? The first question is already answered by giving adequate proofs about Vishnu being supreme.Thereby stating that only if two or more chetanas exist, it makes sense to talk of who is supreme and who is subserviant. Therefore it is pertinant to talk not only about what causes this difference. And whether there is gradation among these other chetanas. The source for this information is veda and it is full of statements about not only difference between chetanas which exists forever but gradation also. This gradation does not lead to discrimination. It is the acceptance of existence of inherent capacities which are different for different jivas. Even in moksha this not only continues but there is a complete harmonious existence of the souls which never even have the thought of inferiority feelings nor superiority complexes. Some sources for the bhedha-difference and taratamya- gradation in vedic ( and upanishadic) texts ananda taratamya in taittitiya upanishat *saishanandasya meemamsa bhavati*| Now about the dradation of bliss is looked into.. ( And this is not in samsara but muktas because the souls discussed here are) *shrotriyasya cha akamahatasya cha* (the jivas are) completed in their knowledge and have their wants fulfilled ( only in mukti the souls have completed their jnana. And as every wish is instantly fulfilled they are not troubled by the wants and needs they get) Chandogya upanishat. *athatah sambhutih paramad vidya vidyayah praanah pranat shriddha shridhayah shivah shivad buddhih* etc where the birth of all from Vishnu in the order of taratamya is given. And at the conclusion it is said that this grdation is permanent and persists in mukti. In bhagavata Rishabha geeta *bhuteshu virudbhya uduttamah ye sarisripasteshu subodhanishtah* | *tato manushyah* *pravarastatopi gandharvasiddhah*... *virinchiviryah sa mataparo..* In those who get bodies plants and then animals are higher. In these manushyas are higher. Gandarvas , siddhas, daksha etc are higher. .and highest is virinchi and I am the greatest in all. This difference and gradation is the natural result of the inherent jnana and bhakti towards vishnu in those jivas. So the knowledge of this taratamya makes us realise the importance of the jana and the resultant bhakti that increases as we go up the ladder of the taratamya. This knowlege is essential because in mukti the souls have to live in harmony. So in the chetanas and the jiva varga *Mukhyaprana* is the highest and is the bridge between all souls and supreme Vishnu. By and by we will try to give more finer details of this subject...
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)

All jivas , right from Chaturmukha Brahma downwards are of the same size. *anu* That is infinitesimally small. But there is difference in other respects. Is the density same for both?

Which are the parameters to decide them? All these have to be thought over

Gururaj Bhandarkar (918892775035@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.10 - 20:43:08
One very popular and the most important 'mahavakya' in Advaita is "Tat tvam asi"= "You are that" which belongs to the Chandogya upanishad....First let us be informed that this is not something like a declaration as we might assume it to be because of the unnecessary hype given by Advaitins.... It's just a part of a whole statement given as an instruction by Uddalaka to his son Shwetaketu...The background given in the upanishad itself is that Shwetaketu returns puffed up and haughty to Uddalaka after several years of Gurukula vaasa thinking that he has learnt everything... It's under such circumstances that Uddalaka starts preaching these things.... He gives 9 examples and at the end of each example declares "sa atmAtattvamasi shwetaketo!"
Gururaj Bhandarkar (918892775035@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.10 - 20:51:17
Fallacy of Advaita Mahavakyas 1 - Prajnanam Brahma http://www.facebook.com/DvaitaDailyDose/posts/601564200007365 Fallacy of Advaita Mahavakya (2) - ayamAtmA brahma http://www.facebook.com/DvaitaDailyDose/posts/601645916665860
2017.04.10 - 20:52:34
B4 i was introduced to philosophy i was first introduced to such "vakyas" However i tried, to understand any spiritual act/ sloka it used to give a wrong meaning because of the wrong meaning given to these _vakyas_ By gods Grace i was later introduced to Madwa philosophy and then one by one meaning became clear.... Thatz the reason I'm asking to first clear this wrong interpretations and then continue ğŸ™ğŸ½
919448835656@s.whatsapp.net (919448835656@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.10 - 20:53:33
Now it's common sense that even a hardcore Advaitin would not directly go on to preach "you are Brahman" to a person who has already become haughty and arrogant due to half knowledge.... This itself is enough to understand that the meaning is different
Gururaj Bhandarkar (918892775035@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.10 - 20:54:29
Uddalaka gives various examples and at the end of each one of them declares tat tvam asi....the irony is that none of the 9 examples given preaches oneness between Jiva and Brahman...how can an example go against the very reason for which that example is being given?? The purpose of an example is to make things clear isn't it?ğŸ˜Š
Gururaj Bhandarkar (918892775035@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.10 - 20:57:13
ğŸ˜ğŸ‘
2017.04.10 - 20:59:23
One such illustration is salt and water example... Uddalaka asks his son to taste saline water from various parts and asks how it tastes? He replies it's "salty"...and then the father goes on to explain that though the salt is in every part of water, we are not able to see it...similarly Brahman pervades everything in this universe... Now where is Advaita here? Salt pervades water but is different from water as we know...Brahman pervades universe but is different from it isn't it? Thus Uddalaka declares "sa atma *atat* tvam asi shwetketo" - "O Shwetaketu! you are *not* that" (Thus the reading accepted by Madhwa is 'atat tvam asi'...this is absolutely fine with the rules of Sanskrit grammar because atmAtattvamasi can be split as atma+atat also. )
Gururaj Bhandarkar (918892775035@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.10 - 21:05:44
All the other 8 examples are also clearly in favour of bhEda as the above one
Gururaj Bhandarkar (918892775035@s.whatsapp.net)

Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.10 - 21:09:34
I will try to narrate a funny incident to lay bare the likes of Tattvamasi. It is my unconventional and satirical take on a serious subject to drive home the point
2017.04.10 - 21:14:29
Principle 1. Read it fully. Otherwise you will misinterpret. PV Sindhu won Silver medal in the 2016 Olympics with Gopichand as the coach. Times of India (or some other English newspaper) tried to interview Gopichand. He wasnt available. So the newspaper interviewed Gopichand's wife. The interview appeared in next day newspaper. The headline was "Sindhu has what I didn't have. My husband" - says Gopichand's wife At first reading, it sounds sensational - as if Sindhu has snatched Gopichand from his wife. The headline was designed that way to grab attention. But further reading reveals that, Gopichand's wife meant, if she too had a coach like her husband, she too had a good chance of winning Olympic medal. But to understand that one has to read beyond the headline. If one were to just read the headline, then one will definitely misinterpret the real story. We know this by common sense in real life. Why then is common sense so uncommon when it comes to Upanishads. Why not read the enter sentence, paragraph or incident of Upanishat and try to understand what it really means when a piece of a sentence is stripped off and made headline as "tatvamasi"?
2017.04.10 - 21:14:38
Gururaji i summarize my understanding.. A. If Tat=Brahma=Water B. Thvam=jiva/me=salt Now Tat Tvam Asi Means A=B which cannot be coz both A and B are different in all respects...right?

Sanjaykumar Shenoy (918056280552@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.10 - 21:21:45
9 illustrations are given. It is boring and repetitive if all the illustrations say the same thing. Jiva and brahman are identical. But Sri Madhvacharya has shown beautifully that each illustration depicts a *different relation between the jiva and paramatma* The water and salt is an illustration which shows paramatma is pervading everything. He is inside everything like the salt in water.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.10 - 21:24:09

Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.10 - 21:31:07
When you look in the upanishats 1) yajneeya mantropanishat or Ishavasya upanishat .. mukhyaprana has been described in 4 places. 2)Talavakara up. 4 3) atharvana up...3 4) Mandooka up. No direct mention but some indirect meanings can be derived. 5) Kathaka up. 8 6) Shatprashna up.. 5 7) Taittiriyopanishad..8 8) Chandogya up...57 9) Brihadaranyakopanishad.. 77 10) Aitareya up.. 41 These are only in the ten major upanishats. I have given only the number to indicate reference. But number does not prove importance. So in next few days we will look at 4-5 of the most important just as a sample. We have to go further to know about others in the pantheon.

919052227346@s.whatsapp.net (919052227346@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 11:37:54
1) "Roma romake koti linga udurisida.." refers to a story that comes in Mahabharata. Bhima, when he goes to get sougandhika, bumps into an asura who is a shiva bhakta. Instead of wasting time fighting with him, Bhima drops a hair strand and a crore lingas are born. The asura gets busy doing linga puja and Bhima keeps moving forward. 2) Not just in Tulasidas' ramacharita manasa, I understand there is at least one purana vakya that says Hanumanta is Rudra. 3) In the dasara pada referred by @919481953449, it is true that its mentioned as 'ekadashiya rudra'. As updated by others in the group, Rudra by 'super primary meaning', means 'Vishnu' and then 'Vayu' and primary meaning is 'Parvati pati Ishwara'. Even in Vishnu sahasra nama, we can note the difference (Rudro bahushira babhruH..) And in Rig bhashya too à¤‹à¤œà¥‹ à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤µà¤£à¤¤à¥‹ à¤°à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¥‹ à¤µà¤¾à¤¯à¥à¤ƒ (Rig bhashya 3.3) 4) Hence, ekadashiya means belonging to the ekadasha indraiyas. We very well know, by now, that Mukhyaprana is the main controller of indriyas. (Refer to the stories mentioned from 5-6 upanishads quoted by Guru and Vishnu mam). 5) Hence, Purandara dasa is mentioning Hanumanta as the 'controller of indriyas', 'the removal of sufferings' etc., Similar to Lord Hari, Vayu too takes on the names of each devata when He resides in them. In Garuda, Vayu resides with the name 'garuda'. In Shesha too, Vayu resides with the name 'shesha'. Similarly, in Rudra, Vayu resides in the form 'Rudra'. "garuda-shesha-bhavaadi naamava | dharisi pavana svaroopadehadi | karaNa niyaamakanu taanu aagippa hariyante ||" (hari katha mrita sara 9.12) Other devatas dont have this place!
Girish Prabhu (919731211477@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 13:01:33

Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 20:10:33
Let us take it one by one. Pratwish bhatmam had posted questions. By tonight we will find out the answers to *1.If jivas are infinite, where do they reside?*
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 20:11:52
All jivas during pralaya reside in mula rupi narayana. As there are five sub categories 1) Those who have achieved moksha 2) Those who have to yet sadhana and achieve moksha 3) both kind of nitya samsaris 4) Those who are in nitya naraka 5) Those who are fit to go to nityanaraka in future srishti. These five types reside around the naabhi (navel) of Lord. On right side above ,on left side above , at the middle of nabhi, right side below and left side below the nabhi. This is during pralaya. When Srishti happens muktas will be enjoying in respective lokas reserved for them. Similarly those who have fully ripe vishnu dvesha ( hate for everything that represents goodness..specially vishnu) will be suffering in nitya narakas. Those who are ripe to do sadhana in current srishti will be doing their respective sadhana in brahnanda.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 20:30:25
Coming to those of nitya samsaris who have completed sadhana will be in sAnrAnika lokas with their mixed suffering and enjoyment
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 20:32:30
And where will be those who are not yet ripe to be born in this creation and do sadhana?
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 20:33:43
All except those who have already achieved their intrinsic status (svarupa) will get aniruddha deha. This is a fine body given by Aniruddha rupi at the beginning of srishti. This aniruddha deha will be destroyed at the time of pralaya. So those jivas who are not yet ready to enter srishti will be in a state called *karma abhimAni dasha* They will be doing mAnasa karma till pralaya. This concept is a bit advanced and we will discuss this at a later date
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 20:45:47
Next question.ğŸ‘‡ğŸ»
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 20:47:21
*Why do we see finite jivas in this srishti? What about other jivas?* Only those jivas who have accumulated enough karma in the karma abhimAni dasha and are ripe to enter srishti will be given sthula deha (gross body). So we see only finite number of jivas in each srishti. Other jivas continue to do manasika karma in *karma abhimAni dasha* state and keep accumulating the karma which goes on increasing till they reach a ripe state in some future srishti and get gross body
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 20:53:24
Members may try to answer this question ğŸ‘‡ğŸ» *2. Jiva is also called anaadi. So from anaadi kaala will he be in this srishti?*

2017.04.12 - 21:34:41
In jiva category you find three subcategories. 1) mukti yogyas.2) nitya samsaris and 3) tamoyogyas. This is an internal constitution which never changes. Right?
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 21:38:23
Now in all these 3 categories there will be those who have attained their status..gati. This means in the mukti yogya category there will be those who have already got mukti and there will be those who will get mukti in future
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 21:41:01
4) those in nitya naraka
Girish Prabhu (919731211477@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 21:42:18
Similarly in tamoyogyas there will be those who have attained nityanaraka in previous sristis and those who are yet to get there
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 21:43:52
Exactly same is the case with nitya samsaris.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 21:44:40
So we have six groups in three types of jivas. In pralaya they are present in five different places around the naabhi of Narayana as I have stated above
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 21:46:30
The nitya samsaris are placed at the level of naabhi
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)

Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 22:02:07
Yes the jeeva will either be in paramatmaas udara or in sristi. As there is no concept of increase or decrease in number of jeevas the jeeva should be either in sristi or inside the body of paramatma.When the paramatma feels that thia jeeva should be given a chance to get moksha(based on sanchita karmaphala,manasa karmaas and prarabdha)he places the jeeva in sristi and jeeva will try to do sadhana to get moksha. When the jeeva attains moksha it will again get inside the deha of paramatma but at differnt place.

919481588342@s.whatsapp.net (919481588342@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 22:43:31
The "Roma romake koti lingava" line from song "Anjikinyatakayya" this place is in dakshina Kannada district of Karnataka, the name of place is Uppinangady, this place is called Gayapada Kshetra and dakshina kashi. The place is where River Netravati and River kumaradhara confluence and place also gets name as sangama kshetra. In this place there is a famous temple called Shri sahasra lingeshwara temple. All the black stone in the river bed is considered to be linga and should not be taken home unless and until if someone wants to construct Shiva temple or do linga pooja
Gopal Pai Man (919886430874@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.12 - 23:00:11
Point 2 : Shri vadirajaru in the glorious work called Tirtha prabhanda writes abt sangama kshetra this way : "Kumaradhara sarita sameta Netravati Yatra taranginiyam trimarga GA teere gatasya roopi trilochanoyasya sahasramurti" ... Meaning follows
Gopal Pai Man (919886430874@s.whatsapp.net)

2017.04.13 - 16:18:25
Reposting a msg from Vishnu Maam All jivas during pralaya reside in mula rupi narayana. As there are five sub categories 1) Those who have achieved moksha 2) Those who have to yet sadhana and achieve moksha 3) both kind of nitya samsaris 4) Those who are in nitya naraka 5) Those who are fit to go to nityanaraka in future srishti. These five types reside around the naabhi (navel) of Lord. On right side above ,on left side above , at the middle of nabhi, right side below and left side below the nabhi. This is during pralaya. When Srishti happens muktas will be enjoying in respective lokas reserved for them. Similarly those who have fully ripe vishnu dvesha ( hate for everything that represents goodness..specially vishnu) will be suffering in nitya narakas. Those who are ripe to do sadhana in current srishti will be doing their respective sadhana in brahnanda.
Sanjaykumar Shenoy (918056280552@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.13 - 16:28:14
How to achieve moksha
918277618209@s.whatsapp.net (918277618209@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.13 - 16:28:53
Jivas(all types) reside around Vishnu's naabhi only during pralaya...when shrishti happens they go to their respective lokas.
Sanjaykumar Shenoy (918056280552@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.13 - 16:30:05
As said in Q 2. Jiva is since anadi. Then they must have a body of their own. It is called as svaroopa deha. Above that they have a deha, like a covering called as linga deha. When they have done enough karma they"ll be brought to shrusti by having another deha upon linga deha, called as aniruddha deha. During birth one more deha covers = sthoola deha. With this the jiva does sadhane. After completion all the external dehas are lost. Only svaroopa deha remains. This state is called moksha. All this happens only with the grace of lord Shri Hari.
Shantala Isloor (919900815037@s.whatsapp.net)

Shantala Isloor (919900815037@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.13 - 16:58:34
Plz see this pic. So after sthoola deha it's swaroopa deha which leads to moksha. However, after sthoola deha there are possibilities of a creature coming back to aniruddha deha or linga deha. Right?
919892519191@s.whatsapp.net (919892519191@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.13 - 17:00:34
Once jivas lose their stoola deha, they wil continue with Aniruddha deha till pralaya. At pralaya, they lose aniruddha deha too irrespective of whether they get moksha now or later. Those who get moksha now, lose the linga deha too. Those who dont get moksha now, get back to srishti after they get a new aniruddha deha
Girish Prabhu (919731211477@s.whatsapp.net)

919448529667@s.whatsapp.net (919448529667@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.13 - 17:10:18
The right one will be draw a solid homogenous round circle which represents *svarUpa deha* Draw a round cover on it. This first covering is *linga deha* This linga deha has many constituents which can be shown later as find concentric circles. Draw another circle. This is *aniruddha deha*

2017.04.13 - 18:53:26
All satvik souls are belonging to dev ganas. Is it right?
919743026057@s.whatsapp.net (919743026057@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.13 - 19:11:01
No. This is the provably the next point in our syllabus. In brief : We saw earlier that Jivas are of 3 types 1)mukti yogya (satvika) 2) nitya samsari (rajasika) 3) tamo yogya (tamasika) Again there are sub divisions within each of the above categories. Among satvikas, there are 5 sub categories Deva, rishi, pitrus, chakravartis, and manushyottamas. Finer hierarchical structures exists in each of the above 5 again. Among devas, Brahma vayu are the highest. Among tamo yogyas, Kali is the lowest.

919892519191@s.whatsapp.net (919892519191@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.13 - 23:12:44
*What happens in moksha and where do the muktas reside.* What was the condition of jivas before mukti? And what changes for the mukta jiva later to qualify as mukta? One à¤‰à¤ªà¤¨à¤¿à¤·à¤¤ describes it à¤…à¤¨à¤¾à¤¦à¤¿à¤®à¤¾à¤¯à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¸à¥à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¯à¤¦à¤¾ à¤œà¥€à¤µà¤ƒ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¬à¥à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡à¥¤ When the jiva wakes up from a sleep induced by maya is woken up. à¤…à¤œà¤‚ à¤…à¤¨à¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤‚ à¤…à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤ªà¥à¤¨à¤‚ à¤…à¤¦à¥à¤µà¥ˆà¤¤à¤‚ à¤¬à¥à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¤à¤¦à¤¾à¥¤à¥¤ Then that jiva knows the ONE who is unborn, never sleeping, never dreaming , ONE without a second. This nidra had no beginning. And was caused by maya which had no beginning. The term sleep used here denote a state where the soul is unaware of his own nature. Also the soul is unaware of the nature of Bimba rupi paramatma who resides in jiva forever. Maya is not something that is a magic of a magician. Maya is a real power. It is the mainly the icchaa of Lord and secondly Lord uses the covers jeeva aachaadika and parama acchadika to achieve this. Both are shown in the image above. After a ripe sadhana Lord decides to cut away all unnatural bonds of the jiva with forces of prakriti and wakes up the jiva. The restraining covers are removed and the jiva is released from the shackles that bind him. So you can see here that the process of mukti is not something automatic ,end result of sadhana. Lord must be pleased with the sadhaka's full and ripe devotion. ( This can only be the due to fulfilment of jnAna and bhakti. Lord has to take the decision to give mukti. The *prasAda* of Lord is the only reason for a soul getting mukti. And what makes Lord decide? The fully mature jnAna and bhakti of the jiva
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 08:09:29
Whats aachaadhika and acchadhika?
Sanjaykumar Shenoy (918056280552@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 08:13:21
à¤†à¤šà¥à¤›à¤¾à¤¦à¤¨ means something that covers it is a thin or thick curtain that separates. Jiva achchhadika covers the jiva himself. It thus prevents the soul from knowing his own real nature
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 08:18:38
Similarly parama acchadika covers the jiva from paramatma
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 08:19:13
Remember the jiva achchhadika does not cover completely but let's some of jiva's real nature shine out at times. For example, in deep sleep Lord ,out of His infinite kAruNya makes the jiva know his real sukha. Therefore after waking up the soul says "I was peacefully sleeping and now refreshed"
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 08:23:08
Both are same words
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 08:23:52
So once the jiva gets mukti, everything that prevents him from knowing and feeling his true self. Now there are no unnatural crutches that make him enjoy or suffer from something that is external. Jiva faces his real self. à¤®à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤¹à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤¾ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾ à¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¤‚ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¥‚à¤ªà¥‡à¤£ à¤µà¥à¤¯à¤µà¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ is the crisp clear definition of mukti. If there are no doubts , let us go to the next step *where muktas reside* in a little while and admins will then open up next question for discussion ğŸ™‚

Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 09:44:13
Madhwaâ€™s philosophy in a nutshell The whole gist of Sri Madhwaâ€™s teachings can be summed up to 5 points: 1. Vishnu is the supreme personality of Godhead. (Note: This does not mean that other Gods are to be neglected and discarded.. Infact Acharya repeatedly says that other Gods who are very close to Vishnu are also to be deeply respected which pleases Vishnu) 2. There is difference between Lord(Paramathma i.e Vishnu) and the Living individuals(athma). Lord is infinite and we souls are finite. There is also differences among each souls 3. World is real, and the claims that world is illusion(Mayavada) is not according to the perception nor scriptures. 4. Mukthi or Salvation is the ultimate Goal. It can be achieved only through pure devotion with pure knowledge and according to intrinsic nature of the soul. 5. Perception, inference and verbal evidence are the means for right knowledge Out of these 5 points, our todays discussions will be on the first point i.e Supremacy of Vishnu (Vishnu Sarvottamatva) How can we jump into conclusion that Vishnu is Supreme ? Arenâ€™t there scriptural evidences that prove that Shiva/Shakthi is supreme ? Below is the answer to these valid questions that may popup in our minds. The common perception is that there are many Godâ€™s mentioned in the Vedas, and hence Hinduism is generally called a mixed pot. This is because Vedas also talk of Rudra, Indra etc being superior. But in reality all these are names of Vishnu (Note that in Vishnu Sahasranama the names Rudra, Indra etc addressing Vishnu as Indra, Rudra, Varuna etc. So these are names of Vishnu only come up, but in the strotras venerating Shiva, ). Further, there are many scriptural quotes that indicate that all Vedas speak of one God Vishnu -In the Rigveda, it is declared " à¤¯à¥‹ à¤¦à¥‡à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¨à¤¾à¤®à¤§à¤¾ à¤à¤• à¤à¤µ"- "He who is the one and only primary bearer of the names of all gods". (X, 82, 3). It is obvious that we don't know who is the "one" referred here. But the same sukta(X,82, 6) answers this question by stating a very specific trait of Vishnu I.e. "à¤…à¤œà¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¨à¤¾à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤§à¥à¤¯à¥‡à¤•à¤®à¤°à¥à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤®à¥"- "From His navel springs one". Now, the only thing known to emerge from the navel, in the scriptures is the lotus and that happens from the navel of Vishnu only. Thus we arrive at a conclusion that the 'One' mentioned here as the primary subject of all epithets of all gods is Vishnu only. - à¤‡à¤‚à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤‚ à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤‚ à¤µà¤°à¥à¤£à¤‚ à¤…à¤—à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤®à¥ à¤†à¤¹à¥à¤°à¤¥à¥‹ à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¥à¤¯: à¤¸ à¤¸à¥à¤ªà¤°à¥à¤£à¥‹ à¤—à¤°à¥à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥¤à¤à¤•à¤‚ à¤¸à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾ à¤¬à¤¹à¥à¤§à¤¾ à¤µà¤¦à¤‚à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤—à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤® à¤¯à¤®à¤‚ à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¤°à¤¿à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¤¾à¤¹à¥: || (I-164-46) "The seers call that One Supreme reality by various names such as Indra, Mitra, Varuna, Agni, the divine bird Garutman, Yama and Matarishwan." -Moreover Kethopanishad says : â€œSarve Veda Yatpadam Amnathiâ€ - All Vedas describe the ONE There are many more scriptural quotes that substantiates this very fact. They will be taken up as we proceed with discussions

When a person goes swimming in the sea, the aim is to swim as much as one wants and reach the destimation one wants using the sea as medium. The aim is never to swim every square inch of sea. Same is true with guna saagara called God. We swim by being fully aware we will never know him fully. The vastness of it should not be the impediment because our goal is never to traverse every inch of that vastness

Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 19:06:21
The above post in english, in brief. Our experience and the knowledge that we get from it is valid. That means one has to accept what we experience in this world is *true* This *truth* is of three types. 1) pAramArthika 2) vyAvahArika and 3) prAtivhAsika. . *pAramArthika satya* (absolute truth) This is defined as *trikAla abhAdhyam satyam* That which is never sublated in past,present and future. That means pAramArthika satya dies not *change* at any time. In taittiriya (2-1 shAnkara bhAShya) That object which has been proved to exist as *such*, never changes its form. One can't say it doesn't exist. Only *parabrahman* is eligible to be called pAramArthika satyam as its existence is uniform with no changes
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 19:20:42
I request Srikant also to put this more simply in english ğŸ™‚
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 19:22:01
Mam, please explain ğŸ™‚
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 19:25:01
Oh..Shankara speaks about truth atleast once.
Sanjaykumar Shenoy (918056280552@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 19:34:30
Not much left after Vishnu maam explained. Truth is generally binary. Either something is real or not real. However advaita accepts 3 gradation of reality in the descending order of lifetime of the reality. The longest and ever lasting is Paramarthika satya The shortest is prAthibhasika - When one momentarily thinks something is truth. For e.g. mistaking a rope to be a snake in dark. The moment the object is realized, the reality of object is known Advaita defines another reality in between the two extreme realities. It is called vyavahaarika reality. This is neither ever lasting reality like paramarthika or so short as pratibhasika. It is this world. The world is a really false. But *we think* it exists. And we think so for long. But not for ever. *The moment we get illuminated by knowledge we realize all this is false. Just like the object thought to be snake gets illuminated by light and manifests as rope. Sounds very convincing right? Now think about this - If you got headache while reading this long boring paragraph.... Guess what. I dont care. Because *that headache is unreal.. Even when you are experiencing it* You are experiencing the unreal. Now let us chew on that ğŸ˜‚
2017.04.14 - 19:38:20
Problem is, there are three truths. â˜¹
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 19:38:47
Perfect. Explanation is very clear about the three grades in the truth in advaita philosophy.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 19:42:16

Bharathi Shenoy (919972993747@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 19:49:41
Here is the meaning of the above song by Sri puttur Narasimha NayakğŸ‘†ğŸ‘†
Bharathi Shenoy (919972993747@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 19:49:59
Things get complicated when they start explaining how such an absolute pAramArthika brahman *changes* to the multiplicity we see as jivas. By definition Brahman doesn't change. See the definition of pAramArthika satyam who is brahman alone. If He doesn't change , how can He *become* all the jivas? To understand this you have to understand the *vivarta vAda*. Here advaita doesn't say brahman actually changes and appears as jivas. But *appears* as jivas due to super imposition. . One question to admins. This subject will make the topic very much complicated. So we can just give a statement on superimposition and proceed to give pramanas for *world is real*
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.14 - 19:53:32
Advaita says brahma satya jaganmithya - Brahma is real. World is unreal. Actually the fallacy of 3 graded truth is a compromise to deal with the realness of the world experienced by all of what is really unreal per advaita. First is the experience of existence of the world by us. Second aspect is that *An unreal (false) entity cannot be created* A pot can be created. But can anybody create the absence of a pot? ğŸ¤” That's advaita's vyavaharika satya. This world which is really false/unreal gets created (like the absence of the pot). But since it is sen and experienced, a gradation of truth is created to accomodate it
2017.04.14 - 19:56:36

2017.04.14 - 21:26:41
Sat and asat if prefixed with desha or kaala can be treated as such for that desha or kaala. An object existed at place p1 at time t1. Hence sat(x) = f(p1,t1) It is asat(x) for all p,t not equal to p1,t1
2017.04.14 - 21:29:11
Brief explanation on superimposition which is the basic for the à¤¸à¤—à¥à¤£ à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤° à¤…à¤µà¤¾à¤šà¥à¤¯ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤¹à¥à¤® *nirguna nirakara avachya brahman* appearing as multiple jivas who are à¤¸à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤° à¤¸à¤—à¥à¤£ à¤¬à¤¦à¥à¤§ *sakara saguna baddha jivas* The typical example to understand this given by advaita is à¤¶à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¤¿ à¤°à¤œà¤¤ , appearance of silver in shell. The à¤…à¤§à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¾à¤¨ , *base* on which the superimposition happens is brahman. Due to maya the silver which is not present is seen in the shell. This silver is mithya. It is seen. Therefore you can't say it is absent. As the silver is seen to be absent after proper examination, it is also not present. So this kind of neither being *absent* nor being *present* is called *mithya* And this jagat, including the jivas are exactly like that

In Bhagavadgita 2nd adhyaya 16th verse. nAsato vidyate bhAvo.. Sri Madhvacharya in gItAtA tparya has gone into details discarding this with proofs and explanations. There can't be a third kind (sat-asat-vilakshaNa) of existence. Those interested to go into details may look it up. As there are no questions on this let us move on to *undeniable* pramanas for the *world is real* and these cannot be explained in any other way than their straight forward intention of saying that this world *is absolutely real* which is basically different from Brahman. Let us see some of those from Vedas and puranas

2017.04.15 - 09:10:00
I received this as a fwd in one of the WA group... WRT point No.4 Mukti has to be our final goal.... but the below story gives an impression that the very Nature of the soul cannot be changed in spite of any pilgrimage/ Sadhana one does.... So what is the solution to this??? *One day,all the disciples went to their master' and said, "Master, Master, we all are going on a pilgrimage.* *Master: Why you want to go on a pilgrimage trip?* *Disciples: So that we can improve our devotion.* *Master: OK. Then do me a favour. Please take this Karela (bitter gourd) along with you and wherever you go and whichever temple you visit, place it in the alter of the Deity, take the blessings and bring it back.* *So, not only the disciples but the Karela also went on pilgrimage, temple to temple.* *And finally when they came back, the Master said, "cook that Karela and serve it to me."* *The disciples cooked it and served it to the master. After having the first bite, the master said,* *"Surprising"!!!!!* *Disciples: What's so surprising?* *Master: Even after the pilgrimage the karela is still bitter.* *How come???'* *Disciples: But that's the very nature of the Karela, Master.* Master: That's what I am *saying. Unless you change your nature, pilgrimage will not make any difference.* *So, you & I, if we do not change ourselves no teacher or guru can make a difference in our lives.* *If you think positively,* *Sound becomes music,* *Movement become dance,* *Smile becomes laughter,* *Mind becomes meditative and* *Life becomes a* *celebration.*

2017.04.15 - 11:34:30
Yes and no Although literally aparoksha means pratyaksha. ... there is a established tenet that God will not be externally visible to anyones sadhana thru external eyes (unless avatara). At the other extreme, people like Duryodhsna have seen God pratyaksha and still didnt manage to get moksha due to their intrinsic nature. Hence one has to see god. But not *see* in normal sense of the word. But the jivatma in us has to see its bimba rupi by itself. Thats the indweller antaryami form.
2017.04.15 - 11:38:22

Sanjaykumar Shenoy (918056280552@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 16:23:15
Now let us see where and in which context upanishat ( Chandogya upanishat) gives that gold and its ornament example. Is is indeed with respect to Lord. But similes are given to teach a concept and one shouldn't extend and impose one's own impressions on it.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 17:50:17
One has seen earlier about shvetaketu and his great father uddalaka. This section also concerns them. I will write the series of beautiful examples and their import and post in next ten mins. ( These are different from the 9 referred to earlier )
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 17:54:07
When shvetaketu returns from gurukula after 12 years of study (at the age of 24 years) he was full of ahankara that he knows everything. Uddalaka, his father feels his son's ego and asks " You haven't yet understood Him and have an inflated ego. Can you tell me, *What is it that when known, everything else is known?* Shvetaketu did not know so he asks father *how is that possible?* Uddalaka then says *When you know a clump of clay, you get the idea of all that is made of clay* *When you know a loha maNi(gold) you know all that is made of metals*. *When you know a nail cutter (made of iron) you know all that is made of iron* Now this is a rough english translation. And precisely because we loose the actual meaning of what is told in translation, we get such bizarre results that God is gold and all the things made in this world are like gold and its ornaments !
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 18:22:15
So let us see the exact sanskrit expression by Sage Uddalaka in teaching his son Shvetaketu who had an hyperinflated ego.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 18:24:05
The exact wordings used are à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾ à¤à¤•à¥‡à¤¨ à¤®à¥ƒà¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¡à¥‡à¤¨... à¤¯à¤¥à¤¾ à¤à¤•à¥‡à¤¨ à¤²à¥‹à¤¹à¤®à¤£à¤¿à¤¨à¤¾.... à¤à¤•à¥‡à¤¨ à¤¨à¤– à¤¨à¤¿à¤•à¥ƒà¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¨à¥‡à¤¨ Here we see one mud ball, one gold mani, one nail cutter. If it is understood as per advaita meaning *one* mud ball is useless, because all things are not made of one mud ball. The upanishat should have said mrit pindena and not ekena mrit pindena. Similarly for ekena loha maNinA. Upanishat should have said simply loha maNinA. Secondly two examples, mud and gold are not required. Only one would be sufficient. And when you come to iron nail cutter the whole trend of advaita meaning goes haywire It should have said *iron* and not nail cutter. All that is made from iron doesn't need to know a nail cutter. For us manda matis these objections look as if we are trying too much to find fault with advaita. But when it comes to understanding upanishadic teachings one has to be careful not to miss it. And when you see the meaning bought out by Sri Madhvacharya you will really see why He is a real master when it comes to recognize the heart of Vedic teachings! ğŸ™ğŸ¼
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 18:56:49
One simply falls down on the ground near His feet when you read and understand Srimad Acharya. â˜º He has not written His own forced meanings on this. Sri Madhva quotes SAmasamhita which explains the above upanishadic portion. Let us enjoy it fully. I will try to give the original sanskrit and a gist in English
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 19:02:52

Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 19:30:54
So sage Uddalaka advises Shvetaketu ..You see a pot or any other vessel made of mud. As you have seen mud, you know that all these are as true as mud from the resemblance. So also when you understand paramatma, you understand that this jagat resembles paramatma and is as true as Lord. When you know the Gold, the supreme among metals, you understand all other things made of metals too. Similarly when you know the supreme Vishnu as an infinity of jnAna and Ananda, you understand other chetanas are also of the same kind, because of resemblance. (Now comes the relevance of mentioning a small , negligible nail cutter.) If you can know that the huge machines are made of iron by knowing such a tiny nail cutter just imagine what you will know by knowing paramatma! Here the example of nail cutter is not just for resemblance. It is given to show that if you know the greater it is easy to know the less important. So the first example is for 1) à¤¸à¤¾à¤¦à¥ƒà¤¶à¥à¤¯ .. resemblance of some sort. This proves that the world has some sort of resemblance to paramatma 2) à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¯ As gold is supreme among metals. So paramatma, Vishnu is supreme. The point of resemblance is only secondary and incidental in this simile. 3) à¤…à¤²à¥à¤ª à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¬à¤¹à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤œà¥à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¥ Knowing in greater details it is easy to know simpler things
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 20:08:50
Ib this section it is also proved that the *world resembles Lord* As there is no question raised in the *reality* of Lord, this *world is thus proven to be as real as Supreme Vishnu, simply because the upanishat says these two resemble each other* Incidentally this gives us all the proof we need that *world is real* That is our present topic open for discussion ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸ™ğŸ¼

2017.04.15 - 20:36:21
Gopal Paimam 1) Gold is pradhana. This you have to see where it us said. In upanishat. So in shastra svarna is pradhana among loha. It may be because of Lakshmidevi's presence. Don't bring in our mundane vyavahara arguments against shastra. You know the reasons
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 20:41:15
2) In our main group we have discussed this. Even jada is a pratibimba of Vishnu. This is from the concept of pratibimbatva. A pratibimba is adheena and sadrisha to bimba. And yes. Vishnu as bimbarupi to chetanas has all rupas. But as far as jada is concerned the pratibimbatva is only in one guna. *sat*
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 20:45:58
3) None of the points you mentioned in case of nail cutter are touched upon in the bhAShya. The reason for mention of nail cutter in the upanishat as told by Aacharya is.. Nail cutter is very very insignificant. If you can know big things made of iron by knowing small things isn't it correct to say that you will know about small things if you know big things of the same material. Here nail cutter=world Big machinery =Vishnu
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 20:51:37

Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 21:02:52
You know about the simile of spider given in some texts to explain a concept. A foreigner listen to it. The god spins a web of this world and remains in the center and controls everything and at pralaya , it enters back into his stomach. So also this world is created from the strands of prakriti which is in His udara and at the time of pralaya. So the foreigner went back and told friends. Hindu God is a spider who spins webs. Sits at the center. And whoever is caught in the web is killed and eaten
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 21:10:45
So Shravan. A simile should have something to teach you about the concept you are trying to prove/learn. The gold and ornaments simile , as far as I can make out , has nothing common with the relation of jivas and Vishnu
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.15 - 21:15:38

919845227048@s.whatsapp.net (919845227048@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.16 - 01:08:29
Few points towards "world is real" :Â  1. The world we see is an creation of paramatma who has Sat-chit-ananda gunas he doesn't have any dosha or short comings he has made this world for our sadhana to know him. He will not create a false world when he itself is real and every sadhaka goal is to know Ultimate supreme soul who is Satya hence any creation of his can't be unreal 2. We see plants grow, humans live, birth and death, pleasure n sorrow, pain and happiness all these characters are felt by human body the water we drink quenches our thirst, the food we eat calms down our hunger, the injury we suffer gives us pain all this is possible in real world we can't say I am a fake entity experiencing fake things in fake world. Hence if all activities we encounter r true to our senses then also is the creation where God has manifested his portion so that it runs for our benefitÂ  3. In Vishnu sahasranama the first word is Vishwam which means god enables this world with activities, god is supreme power who is king to this world, god is one who gives the creation the jnana, the Ananda bhakti and bhakti vatsalya hence he is called Vishwam means one who is integral part of the world which without him is non functional. 4. He creates this world with ease. Since creation is one of his kartrutva or duty (so that we know his power and greatness he performs this duty) among 8 duties that is srusti or creation, stiti the status quo, laya means the destruction, and then other five jnana the knowledge bank about him, ajnana the ignorance, niyamana means the motivation to do any karya, bandha means bondage with samsara and living in sukha dukha and finally moksha means liberation. Since creation itself is first karya then how can god fake himself ?? ( Point 4 is taken from book santatam chintaye anantam by srikanth Shenoy maam) since God can't fake in any of his duties world the creation is super super realÂ  Â 
Gopal Pai Man (919886430874@s.whatsapp.net)

Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 10:45:51

919845227048@s.whatsapp.net (919845227048@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 10:46:12
A mirror should be clean . Only then it will reflect clearly. Second . The waters of a pond should not only be clean but *calm* Then you can see what is at the bottom. Many of our daily rituals, yatras, teerth snAna etc achieve this goal. Our chitta and antahkarana become clean. They get focus and are undisturbed by extraneous thoughts. This is the first step
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)

919892519191@s.whatsapp.net (919892519191@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 10:51:33
Wrong. Moksha is not the phala of good karmas..directly. Please know that Sri Madhwacharya has stressed this many times. The only reason we get moksha is because Vishnu makes up His mind , out of His karunya , to grant moksha. But our nishkaama karmas which strengthen our devotion in Lord make Him grant moksha.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 10:54:56

919892519191@s.whatsapp.net (919892519191@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 10:55:59
If any karma is done with phalapeksha it binds. But karmas done to please Lord result in getting His grace. And that grace *alone* results in moksha

It is said tht Brahma has written everything. Vidhi baraha/ Hane baraha/ Fate. 1. So now if he has written everything then what is the point in doing what I want. 2. If he has not written tht I will lead a bhaktiful life or a gud karma life then how will I lead tht. In this even if I want to change, my Hane baraha will not allow.
919892519191@s.whatsapp.net (919892519191@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 11:08:11
ğŸ˜ğŸ˜
919892519191@s.whatsapp.net (919892519191@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 11:08:20
Brahman baraile hane baraha. This must be understood correctly. I will give an example to make it more clear
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 11:10:47
You have prepared for lunch and you are eating it. You have to. Because only you have prepared it for yourself. You eat it and finish it. Now while eating you are planning and getting things for tomorrow's lunch. If today's lunch was tasteless or bad , do you want to eat same tomorrow? Or if today's lunch was tasty and you enjoyed it, you want another enjoyable lunch tomorrow also.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 11:16:23
The lunch served is brahmana baraile hane baraha. We call it Prarabdha. You earned it. So you enjoy/suffer it.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 11:17:49
More of such earned lunch boxes are packed And are tied in a large bag to your back. These are called *sanchit* karmas. As one box is finished , brahma opens another box for you to eat
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 11:21:14
That is why we can never say *havu meggeli karma pura bhoggunu mukti pavtalo*
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 11:22:36
Got it sir. It is not written by Brahma. It is written by us only. We do gud things. Gud things will be written in our book.
919892519191@s.whatsapp.net (919892519191@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 11:22:57
In one space of finishing a Prarabdha, we earn sufficient for a minimum of lunch boxes (sanchita karmas) for 10 janmas. So how can it be ever possible for one to get mukti?
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 11:24:55

919892519191@s.whatsapp.net (919892519191@s.whatsapp.net)

Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 11:26:09
When He is pleased and bestows His grace, the first thing He does is to burn all *sanchita karma* .Gives away those lunch boxes to others. And only one lunch box opened for eating *Prarabdha* remains. The moment you finish it , you get mukti.

Bhagavadgita 3rd adh 19 shloka onwards.. à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤…à¤¸à¤•à¥à¤¤: à¤¸à¤‚à¤¤à¤¤à¤‚ à¤•à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¯à¤‚ à¤¸à¤®à¤¾à¤šà¤° à¥¤ à¤…à¤¸à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¹à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤šà¤¾à¤°à¤¨à¥ à¤•à¤°à¥à¤® *à¤ªà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤¨à¥‹à¤¤à¤¿* à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤·à¤ƒ à¥¤ It is compulsory for all to do karmas. Therefore do your duties without any attachments. One who does so, achieves *Him* or final goal. Look at the *param aapnoti* and the way is *asakto karma Acharan hi* Doing karna with bo attachment. You can look up next few shlokas also.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 12:07:41
It is not too important to keep bothering about phalas. What is more important is to bother about *does this karma leads to vishnu preeti or not*?. To give phala or not is His iccha. Suppose He gives phala, good/bad. What of it? I am not bothered. Let Him. My main purpose to please Him is served. That is the way to approach karma ğŸ™‚ğŸ™‚
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)

Vidyadhar Sha (919900173230@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 18:30:03
This one too
Vidyadhar Sha (919900173230@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 18:30:23
This adhyaya clarifies that the doubt that *sanyaas* is not giving up karmas and *yoga* is not grahastha ashrama for doing karmas. The way to please Lord is to do karmas with a clear understanding that *Lord is getting the karmas done as a worship to Him* The enlightened one does karmas like this giving up the thought that *he is independently doing karmas* The kartritva seen in a jiva is *dependent on paramatma*. These points are explained in verses 11,12,13. In 14th verse. A major misunderstanding is cleared. We may think that Lord has given us independence in doing karma and their phala like the king gives power to his servants. This is also not right. All independence remains with Him. The jivas have only kartritva. Therefore in the 15th verse quoted by you Sri Krishna says. All independence lies in Him. Jivas don't realise this because their buddhi is covered with ajnAna. But does this karma phala affect Lord? That too is not possible because of His supreme independence. I suggest you to read the Bhagavadgita bhashyha and tatparya of Sri Madhvacharya on these verses from 11 to 15 for further details. At present this much is sufficient. This subject needs a detailed discussion on Karma as given in Bhagavadgita.. à¤•à¤°à¥à¤®à¤£à¤¾ à¤—à¤¹à¤¨à¥‹ à¤—à¤¤à¤¿à¤ƒ
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.18 - 19:00:57

919892519191@s.whatsapp.net (919892519191@s.whatsapp.net)

We can take up the fifth point ............ Madhwaâ€™s philosophy in a nutshell ... 5. Perception, inference and verbal evidence are the means for right knowledge
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 10:55:07
Is verbal evidence is an evidence? Can it be manipulated??
919892519191@s.whatsapp.net (919892519191@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 11:54:03
I meant it can be manipulated. So how will we take tht??
919892519191@s.whatsapp.net (919892519191@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 11:54:50
Simply putting it is like this. We gather so much information. For this we use our jnAnendriyas. Eyes, ears, nose, tongue, touch and all this is fed to mind. (Manas) It processes that input and comes to a conclusion. This conclusion leads to our understanding *about the objects and subjects within the field of our five senses*
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 11:57:47
What do you understand by the term *verbal evidence?*
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 11:58:25
Verbal evidence is the quotes or gyan given by gyanis of same sampradaya.
919892519191@s.whatsapp.net (919892519191@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 11:59:39
Sorry not a correct understanding. Primarily verbal evidence is defined as *nirdhosha shabda* A text that can not have any fault. We will understand how such a thing is possible. To understand this you have to first have a clear idea of perception.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 12:06:37
Let me ask one question. What is perception?
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 12:07:32
Perception is *pratyaksha* The knowledge we get from our panchendriyas. Can we rely on our panchendriyas to give us correct information?
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 12:12:32
Usually under ideal conditions our indriyas give us correct information. For example. An object seen in a good light, neither too bright nor too dark, at a comfortable distance , neither too far nor too near, and when our eyesight is normal. The information gathered by our eyes will give us *correct* information. This applies to all indriyas. So instead of plain pratyaksha I will modify it to *pareekshita pratyaksha* That means you can't say even bhrAnti is also a correct one.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 12:17:41
The rope looks like a snake because, it is far off, seen in poor light and the person may also be having poor eyesight. Here conditions are *not right* to give correct information. Just because you mistake a rope for a snake *occasionally under faulty conditions of seeing* DOES NOT mean every time you see a rope , you see a snake. Nor does it mean every time you see a snake, it is really a rope ğŸ˜‚
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 12:22:06
So now think how strong can a pratyaksha be. Your jnAnendriyas are sufficient to give you correct information about what you see, hear, smell, taste and touch. With the help of a focused mind in good condition. The information you thus have can not be proved wrong even by Veda! That is the position of *perception* in its field of application. Please think about this. Any questions are welcome
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 12:26:07
Can we rely on perception all the time. Won't it go wrong at times??
919892519191@s.whatsapp.net (919892519191@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 12:39:59
So here *Pareekshita pratysksha* means *bhranti*
919892519191@s.whatsapp.net (919892519191@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 12:40:44
We mortals have our perception conditioned since the day we are born..there is a greater possibility of going wrong
Sanjaykumar Shenoy (918056280552@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 12:41:00
Pareekshita pratyaksha is not bhrAnti. It is pareekshita. You see a snake in a bit of darkness. At first sight you get frightened. Then you go near to check whether it is really a snake. That means you do a à²ªà²°à³€à²•à³à²·à²¾ (à¤ªà¤°à¥€à¤•à¥à¤·à¤¾) . Then you realize it is not a snake but a rope. The *rope* is the à²ªà²°à³€à²•à³à²·à²¿à²¤ à²ªà³à²°à²¤à³à²¯à²•à³à²· . Therefore it is the right knowledge
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 13:39:35
Sanjay mam. If you do not believe that your own senses are not reliable and are conditioned , how will you believe what you are seeing, hearing, tasting is right or not?
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 13:41:22
If you see a red coloured rose by holding it in your hand and looking at it in a good light, would you believe if I say it is Mogra and that too blue coloured Mogra? If you disagree can I say you are seeing a red coloured rose only because your eyes are conditioned?â˜º
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 13:43:46
So in the *field of sense perception* your own senses are supreme in telling you the correct information
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 13:44:57
Ok you are right in terms of seeing objects...but objects are not the only things we see and perceive...there are lot of other things..for example if a boy and girl standing at the corner of the road and talking...one of them may actually ask an address or something like that but i may perceive them as loversğŸ˜Š
Sanjaykumar Shenoy (918056280552@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 13:48:04
You are now stepping into the field of *anumaan* Logic. We will consider it next. Good that you raised it. A boy and girl talking is perception. But to know about *whether they are lovers or not* comes under *inference*. That is not perception. You don't *see* the love they may have or may not have. You guess after seeing some signs and after *inference* conclude that they are lovers or not lovers. ğŸ™‚
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 13:53:59
Absolutely...there could have been another boy and girl talking in the same corner in the past and could have eloped so i perceive/infer(ğŸ˜Š) that anybody standing and talking in that corner are going to elope
Sanjaykumar Shenoy (918056280552@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 13:57:41
Incorrect understanding of pratyaksh (perception) and anunAna(inference). Perception is limited to what you perceive from sensory organs. Inference comes in to help when there is some doubt in perceptions only. For example when you look at the rope in not so good conditions you see snake wrongly. But to resolve the doubt *is this a rope or is this a snake*? No amount of argument will settle it. For every argument that it is a rope, you can give a counter argument that it is a snake. The issue is settled only by *another stronger perception* that is when you actually go near and see from close that *it is rope* Your doubt was resolved *not by any argument* but by another *stronger tested perception* that it is a rope. So let us first have a clear idea about perception and inference
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 16:28:55
Separate out perception and inference here.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 16:30:43
So in everything related to sense perception, the knowledge gathered and its correctness can only come from perception only. So why inference is needed? We will see its limited scope after we know what is *verbal evidence* and where it applies
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 16:37:27
For beginners as well as advanced learning about this subject the following is a very beautiful book
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 16:52:35
https://archive.org/details/reignofrealismin032789mbp
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 16:53:40
Verbal evidence applies to the field where our senses or sensory perception doesn't go. For example what is dharma, adharma, punya ,papa, svarga, naraka, atma apart from physical body, demigods, supreme god-brahman etc.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 17:37:54
à¤‡à¤‚à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤¤à¥€à¤¤ à²‡à²‚à²¦à³à²°à²¿à²¯à²¾à²¤à³€à²¤ we call it. Why these are indriyateetha? Let me illustrate with an example.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 17:39:26
Take *dharma* Now what is dharma? It is a way of behaviour as laid down by shastra. And when you go according to it you earn *punya* Now can anyone tell me what are the colours of dharma and punya? What do they smell like? What is their shape and their weight?
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 17:46:21
Necessarily you need to have something more than sense perception to know about these things verbal evidence is the only source. This is said to be of two types. One is à¤ªà¥Œà¤°à¥à¤·à¥‡à¤¯ à²ªà³Œà²°à³à²·à³‡à²¯ Or those texts which are composed by Aptas. Example of Apta is Veda vyasa. He is sarvajna and when He has written in samaadhi bhasha, they are all correct sources to know truth in the indriyateetha field. Second and more important is . à¤…à¤ªà¥Œà¤°à¥à¤·à¥‡à¤¯ à²…à²ªà³Œà²°à³à²·à³‡à²¯ texts. These are not composed by anyone. Not even by God. By their very nature , they are the sources of perfect and correct knowledge.
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 18:41:14
Coming to Inference. When two seemingly conflicting points are to be settled to arrive at a correct meaning we need inference or logic or anumAna. A very brief sketch on what is anumAma or logic will be given
Vishnu Shanbhag (919880241668@s.whatsapp.net)
2017.04.19 - 18:43:50
Summary of some points covered 1. High weightage is given to pratyaksha in Dvaita. Because defectless experience can never be wrong. Or can be said to be false. This is very true in case of things seen and experienced. There are 7 types of pratyaksha - 5 sense organs + mind + soul itself. Sri Vishnu Shanbhag has dealt with the first 6 types of pratyaksha 2. In case of things we cant see, we try to deduce. It uses mind, intellect and logic. As in If there is a smoke, there must be a fire. But *inference is not an independent pramana*. The reason someone concludes that there is a fire when seeing smoke because they have previously *seen" the occurrence of two together. Hence it is a previous observed (pratyaksha) phenomena that is driving the current inference.
2017.04.19 - 19:20:37
3. When it comes to things that cannot be perceived with sense organs or can be deduced by ones own intellect - there is need for Agama pramana. Such non-perceivable entities include - Punya/Paapa, dharma/adharma, God/soul For e.g. Is God 10 headed and 11 legged? Killing people is not adharma. I am only helping to reduce the population on earth. Such conclusions can be proven to be true by plain logic/inference. It is exactly why these things can *only be understood by Agama pramana* - The scriptural texts (Which one Gita, Veda, Quran, Bible ? - This is a topic for later discussion).
2017.04.19 - 19:20:49
If there is *ONE GOLDEN RULE* when it comes to spirituality (non perceivable entites) it is this - *inference is not an independent pramana* Hence things like "I think God is Vishnu Allah and Birla", "In my opinion All gods Vishnu Shiva are all equal" are worthless. They are as good (bad) as saying.... "That flower which bloomed in the sky is very fragrant". Such questions have come before and the systematic intro provided by Sri Vishnu Shanbhagh dispels such things in short and easy manner as possible The key take away is if our statements start with *In my opinion God is so and so and is same as so and so and named so and so*, then please immediately let us remind ourselves *spiritualty does not conform to what I or you or they think. It is driven by facts and Facts
2017.04.19 - 19:20:51
*And facts are not emotions. Facts are not opinions. THEY ARE JUST FACTS*
2017.04.19 - 19:21:52
Coming to opinions - I have a opinion. *I have never seen Kidney. I think kidney is located in brain* It is also a good way of spiritual outlook. I may have a opinion about God. I may think very highly of my opinion. At the end of the day it is still a opinion. And everybody has opinion. So let us first stop passing our opinions as facts and Secondly accept the fact that my or anybody's opinions aren't worth a dime in the field of spirituality without strong backing of Agama pramANa.
2017.04.19 - 19:25:49
Doctors have dissected and found the kdney is in certain location and brain in another location. So even though we havent seen either ourselves, we trust the surgeons who has done dissection and shown to us. Surgeons may be trusted as Apta for the field of human anatomy. But if a surgeon comes and tells you pancreas is in hip, it wont be accepted. Because there are books written previously by those who have seen that it first hand. Similarly there is God who we have not seen. There are rishis and others who have seen. And for those whose rishis whose conclusion is in accordance with the scriptures , their conclusion is honored because it is also well documented in the select subset of books that have come to us in parampara
2017.04.19 - 19:29:33

As browsing large amount of content on the phone - those who are interested in offline viewing of contents on computer san do the following: 1. Root your phone. Copy the following two files from this folder to your external sd card: a. msgstore.db b. wa.db 4. Then copy these two files to your computer 5. Download whatsapp viewer to your computer from http://andreas-mausch.de/whatsapp-viewer/ 6. Open the exe and supply the above 2 db files. 7. Read directly from whatsapp viewer or export html and browse it
